get.description:
<!-- User-facing documentation, rendered as html-->
FileContent represents a single file and its metadata, which can be added and removed from
repositories.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: relative_path
parameters.description: Filter results where relative_path matches value

parameters.name: repository_version
parameters.description: Repository Version referenced by HREF

parameters.name: repository_version_added
parameters.description: Repository Version referenced by HREF

parameters.name: repository_version_removed
parameters.description: Repository Version referenced by HREF

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

post.description: Trigger an asynchronous task to create content,optionally create new repository version.

parameters.name: artifact
parameters.description: Artifact file representing the physical content

parameters.name: relative_path
parameters.description: Path where the artifact is located relative to distributions base_path

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: An uploaded file that may be turned into the artifact of the content unit.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: A URI of a repository the new content unit should be associated with.

get.description:
<!-- User-facing documentation, rendered as html-->
FileContent represents a single file and its metadata, which can be added and removed from
repositories.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

parameters.name: file_content_href
parameters.description: URI of File Content. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/content/file/files/1/

get.description: FileDistributions host File Publications which makes the metadata and the referenced File Content available to HTTP clients. Additionally, a FileDistribution with an associated FilePublication can be the target url of a File Remote , allowing another instance of Pulp to sync the content.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: name__in
parameters.description: Filter results where name is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: base_path__contains
parameters.description: Filter results where base_path contains value

parameters.name: base_path__icontains
parameters.description: Filter results where base_path contains value

parameters.name: base_path__in
parameters.description: Filter results where base_path is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

get.description: FileDistributions host File Publications which makes the metadata and the referenced File Content available to HTTP clients. Additionally, a FileDistribution with an associated FilePublication can be the target url of a File Remote , allowing another instance of Pulp to sync the content.

get.description: FilesystemExporters export content from a publication to a path on the file system.

parameters.name: name__in

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: fields

get.description: A FilePublication contains metadata about all the File Content in a particular File Repository Version. Once a FilePublication has been created, it can be hosted using the File Distribution API.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: repository_version
parameters.description: Repository Version referenced by HREF

parameters.name: pulp_created__lt
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_created is less than value

parameters.name: pulp_created__lte
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_created is less than or equal to value

parameters.name: pulp_created__gt
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_created is greater than value

parameters.name: pulp_created__gte
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_created is greater than or equal to value

parameters.name: pulp_created__range
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_created is between two comma separated values

parameters.name: pulp_created
parameters.description: ISO 8601 formatted dates are supported

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

post.description: Trigger an asynchronous task to publish file content.

get.description: A FilePublication contains metadata about all the File Content in a particular File Repository Version. Once a FilePublication has been created, it can be hosted using the File Distribution API.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

delete.description: A FilePublication contains metadata about all the File Content in a particular File Repository Version. Once a FilePublication has been created, it can be hosted using the File Distribution API.

parameters.name: file_publication_href
parameters.description: URI of File Publication. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/publications/file/file/1/

get.description: FileRemote represents an external source of File Content. The target url of a FileRemote must contain a file manifest, which contains the metadata for all files at the source.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: name__in
parameters.description: Filter results where name is in a comma-separated list of values

parameters.name: pulp_last_updated__lt
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_last_updated is less than value

parameters.name: pulp_last_updated__lte
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_last_updated is less than or equal to value

parameters.name: pulp_last_updated__gt
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_last_updated is greater than value

parameters.name: pulp_last_updated__gte
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_last_updated is greater than or equal to value

parameters.name: pulp_last_updated__range
parameters.description: Filter results where pulp_last_updated is between two comma separated values

parameters.name: pulp_last_updated
parameters.description: ISO 8601 formatted dates are supported

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

post.description: FileRemote represents an external source of File Content. The target url of a FileRemote must contain a file manifest, which contains the metadata for all files at the source.

get.description: FileRemote represents an external source of File Content. The target url of a FileRemote must contain a file manifest, which contains the metadata for all files at the source.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

patch.description: Trigger an asynchronous partial update task

parameters.name: file_remote_href

FileRepository represents a single file repository, to which content can be synced, added,
or removed.

get.description:
<!-- User-facing documentation, rendered as html-->
FileRepositoryVersion represents a single file repository version.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to exclude from the response.

delete.description: Trigger an asynchronous task to delete a repositroy version.

parameters.name: file_repository_version_href
parameters.description: URI of Repository Version. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/repositories/file/file/1/versions/1/

post.description: Trigger an asynchronous task to repair a repositroy version.

parameters.name: file_repository_version_href
parameters.description: URI of Repository Version. e.g.: /pulp/api/v3/repositories/file/file/1/versions/1/

artifact.title: Artifact
artifact.description: Artifact file representing the physical content

relative_path.title: Relative path
relative_path.description: Path where the artifact is located relative to distributions base_path

base_path.title: Base path
base_path.description: The base (relative) path component of the published url. Avoid paths that                     overlap with other distribution base paths (e.g. "foo" and "foo/bar")

base_url.title: Base url
base_url.description: The URL for accessing the publication as defined by this distribution.

name.title: Name
name.description: Unique name of the file system exporter.

path.title: Path
path.description: File system location to export to.

task.title: Task
task.description: A URI of the task that ran the Export.

params.title: Params
params.description: Any additional parameters that were used to create the export.

publication.title: Publication
publication.description: A URI of the publication to be exported.

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: A URI of the repository to be published.

distributions.description: This publication is currently hosted as defined by these distributions.

items.description: This publication is currently hosted as defined by these distributions.

manifest.title: Manifest
manifest.description: Filename to use for manifest file containing metadata for all the files.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this remote.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL of an external content source.

ca_cert.title: Ca cert
ca_cert.description: A string containing the PEM encoded CA certificate used to validate the server certificate presented by the remote server. All new line characters must be escaped.

client_cert.title: Client cert
client_cert.description: A string containing the PEM encoded client certificate used for authentication. All new line characters must be escaped.

client_key.title: Client key
client_key.description: A PEM encoded private key used for authentication.

tls_validation.title: Tls validation
tls_validation.description: If True, TLS peer validation must be performed.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to be used for authentication when syncing.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to be used for authentication when syncing.

pulp_last_updated.title: Pulp last updated
pulp_last_updated.description: Timestamp of the most recent update of the remote.

policy.title: Policy
policy.description: The policy to use when downloading content. The possible values include: 'immediate', 'on_demand', and 'streamed'. 'immediate' is the default.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this repository.

add_content_units.description: A list of content units to add to a new repository version. This content is added after remove_content_units are removed.

remove_content_units.description: A list of content units to remove from the latest repository version. You may also specify '*' as an entry to remove all content. This content is removed before add_content_units are added.

base_version.title: Base version
base_version.description: A repository version whose content will be used as the initial set of content for the new repository version

remote.title: Remote
remote.description: A URI of the repository to be synchronized.

mirror.title: Mirror
mirror.description: If ``True``, synchronization will remove all content that is not present in the remote repository. If ``False``, sync will be additive only.

ContentSummary.title: Content summary
ContentSummary.description: Various count summaries of the content in the version and the HREF to view them.

base_version.title: Base version
base_version.description: A repository version whose content was used as the initial set of content for this repository version
